quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Sally Field and Film
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, field, co-star. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Was Sally Field a cheerleader in high school?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In a 1986 film, Mr. Peterson portrayed a character named Will Graham.  Give the name of the film, and its director.

options.text: Ferrris Buellers Day Off - John Hughes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manhunter - Michael Mann

questions.question: Who did Sally Field marry in 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen Craig

questions.question: In what year was actress Sally Field born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1946

questions.question: In 1985,  Mr. Peterson played a U.S. Secret Service agent in Willliam L. Friedkins film, To Live and Die in L.A.  His characters first name was Rick.  Was the last name Choice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: This 1992 film, directed by Ron Howard, starred Nicole Kidman as an Irish immigrant who made her way to the United States to take part in the Land Run of 1893.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Far and Away

questions.question: Sally Field got her start as a surfer girl on the 1960s show Gidget.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In which 1993 movie did Sally Field co-star with Robin Williams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mrs. Doubtfire

questions.question: During her 2007 Emmy Award acceptance speech, Sally Field made a pro-war statement.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This movie, directed and co-written by Stanley Kubrick and based on the novel Traumnovelle, stars Nicole Kidman and Tom Cruise, who play a troubled couple in New York City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eyes Wide Shut

questions.question: William Peterson wears an old football jersey in many of his movies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Sally Fields birth mother and father divorced in 1950.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In which movie did Sally Field provide the voice of a cat named Sassy?

options.text: Homeward Bound II: Lost In San Francisco

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of These

questions.question: Which of these actors did not act with Peterson in the film To Live and Die in L.A.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stockard Channing

questions.question: In this little known 1992 comedy,  William Peterson played a character named Frank Scanlon.  Name the movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Passed Away

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Nicole Kidman and Jerry Orbach
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Actor Jerry Orbach studied drama and acting in which two famous educational institutions?

options.text: Uta Hagens Acting Academy and The Aspen Acting Space
University of Southern California and the Actors Studio
Northwestern University and the Actors Studio
Uta Hagens Acting Academy and the Actors Studio

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northwestern University and the Actors Studio

questions.question: Nicole Kidman provided the voice of Norma Jean in what 2006 animated comedy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Happy Feet

questions.question: In this film Nicole Kidman and Sandra Bullock play sisters who are witches and belong to a family that is cursed - any man who falls in love with a woman from the family will die tragically.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Practical Magic

questions.question: American actor Jerry Orbach was born on October 20, 1935 in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York City

questions.question: This 2001 horror/suspense film stars Nicole Kidman as a mother of two young children living in a house they assume to be haunted, only to find out they are the ghosts inhabiting the house.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Others

questions.question: This 2003 movie stars Nicole Kidman and Jude Law as lovers torn apart by the Civil War and Renee Zelweger as a helping hand.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cold Mountain

questions.question: In this movie Nicole Kidman plays a woman named Isabel who just wants to live a normal life. She meets a failing movie star who wants to find an unknown actress to star with him in a TV show and he picks her for the role.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bewitched

questions.question: Jerry Orbach starred with Anna Maria Alberghetti in which Tony-award winning Broadway musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carnival

questions.question: Nicole Kidman starred with Matt Dillon and Joaquin Phoenix in this novel-based movie about an older woman who seduces a teenage boy and convinces him to kill her husband.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To Die For

questions.question: Jerry Orbach received his first Tony Award nomination for his portrayal of Sky Masterson, in which Broadway show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guys and Dolls

questions.question: This 1989 thriller stars Sam Neill and Nicole Kidman as a couple vacationing on their yacht in the Pacific. They come across a stranded man played by Billy Zane, who claims to have lost his companions on a sinking ship.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dead Calm

questions.question: Nicole Kidman plays Dr. Chase Meridian in this 1995 superhero film also starring Val Kilmer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Batman Forever

questions.question: This thriller/action movie stars George Cooney as a Special Forces Intelligence Officer and Nicole Kidman as a nuclear expert for the White House.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Peacemaker

questions.question: In his first major role, actor Jerry Orbach played El Galo, in which 1960 musical comedy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fantasticks

questions.question: This 2004 film stars Nicole Kidman as a young widow, who believes her dead husband has been reincarnated into a young boy, who has intimate knowledge of the past she shared with her deceased husband.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birth

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Redd Foxx and Sanford
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was Redd Foxx name at birth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Elroy Sanford

questions.question: John Cazale was engaged to which Oscar-winning actress?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meryl Streep

questions.question: Redd Foxx was once called Chicago Red so that he would not be confused with another red-headed man called Detroit Red. Who was this man?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malcolm Little

questions.question: When was the show Sanford and Son aired?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1972-1977

questions.question: Actor John Cazale died on March 12, 1978, in New York from what disease?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bone cancer

questions.question: Who played Fred Sanfords son on the sitcom Sanford and Son?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Demond Wilson

questions.question: Where was the junkyard located in the TV series Sanford and Son?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles

questions.question: When was Redd Foxx born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12 /9//1922 in Saint Louis, MO

questions.question: Which statement regarding Redd Foxx is false?

options.text: The IRS seized his house and jewelry in a raid in 1989.
The original choice for Fred Sanford was Clevon Little.
Redd has a star on the L.A. Walk of Fame.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Redd has a star on the L.A. Walk of Fame.

questions.question: A member of  the Our Gang troop starred in Sanford and Son.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Why did Redd Foxx quit the show Sanford and Son?

options.text: CBS offered him a three picture deal.
NBC wanted to replace him with Flip Wilson.
He got his own variety show on ABC.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He got his own variety show on ABC.

questions.question: Name the actor on Sanford and Son who played Freds friend, Grady Wilson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whitman Mayo

questions.question: How did Redd Foxx get the name Fred Sanford for the lead role on the show Sanford and Son?

options.text: It was Redds name when he was a boxer.
He needed a short name so he picked Fred.
It was Redds brothers real name .
It was the first name of the corresponding character in the British version of the show.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was Redds brothers real name .

questions.question: Which statement about Redd Foxx is untrue?

options.text: In the 40s and 50s Redd engaged in illegal activities including draft dodging.
Redd was one of the first comedians to use relationship humor in his  act.
Redd took his last name from baseball star Jimmy Foxx.
Redd first gained comedic fame with his very raunchy stand-up.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Redd was one of the first comedians to use relationship humor in his  act.

questions.question: When Redd Foxx first entered show business, segregation forced him to perform at segregated clubs. What was the collective name given to these clubs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Chitlin Circuit
